com.edugility.liquiunit

Class LiquiunitRule

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.junit.rules.ExternalResource
      • com.edugility.liquiunit.LiquiunitRule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TestRule

    public class LiquiunitRule
extends ExternalResource
    An ExternalResource that performs a Liquibase update operation before a given test run.
    Author:
    Laird Nelson
    See Also:
    before(), Liquibase.update(String), ExternalResource

    • Constructor Detail

      • LiquiunitRule

        public LiquiunitRule(DataSource dataSource,
                     String... contexts)
        Creates a new LiquiunitRule.

        The new LiquiunitRule will have changelog resource names of "changelog.xml" and "test-changelog.xml", and a ResourceAccessor initialized with the following code:

        final ResourceAccessor classLoaderAccessor = new ClassLoaderResourceAccessor(Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader());
final ResourceAccessor urlAccessor = new URLResourceAccessor(classLoaderAccessor);
final ResourceAccessor fileAccessor = new FileSystemResourceAccessor(System.getProperty("user.dir"));
new CompositeResourceAccessor(urlAccessor, classLoaderAccessor, fileAccessor);

        Consider passing an H2Rule as the value for the dataSource parameter for thread-safe parallel in-memory database testing scenarios.

        Parameters:
        dataSource - the DataSource to use to acquire a Connection; may be null in which case this LiquiunitRule will effectively do nothing
        contexts - a variable number of Liquibase contexts; may be null
        See Also:
        DataSource.getConnection(String, String), setContexts(Iterable), setResourceAccessor(ResourceAccessor), setChangeLogResourceNames(Iterable)

    • Method Detail

      • getChangeLogResourceNames

        public Iterable<? extends String> getChangeLogResourceNames()
        Returns the classpath resource names of the changelogs that the associated Liquibase instance should use during update operations.

        This method may return null.

        At construction time, this property is set to "changelog.xml" and "test-changelog.xml".

        Returns:
        the classpath resource names of the changelogs that the associated Liquibase instance should use during update operations, or null
        See Also:
        setChangeLogResourceNames(Iterable), LiquiunitRule(DataSource, String[])

        Parameters:
        names - the classpath resource names of the changelogs that the associated Liquibase instance should use during update operations; may be null
        See Also:
        getChangeLogResourceNames()

        public Iterable<? extends String> getContexts()

        This method may return null.

        Returns:
        an Iterable of Strings, or null
        See Also:

      • before

        protected void before()
               throws LiquibaseException,
                      SQLException
        Overrides the ExternalResource.before() method to acquire a Connection, find the proper Liquibase Database implementation, create a Liquibase instance and, using it, update the backing database using the affiliated changelogs.
        Overrides:
        before in class ExternalResource
        Throws:
        LiquibaseException - if there was a Liquibase-related error
        SQLException - if there was a database-related error
        See Also:
        DataSource.getConnection(String, String), createLiquibase(Database), shouldUpdate(Liquibase), getContexts(), Liquibase.update(String)

      • createLiquibase

        protected Liquibase createLiquibase(Database database)
                             throws LiquibaseException
        Tries to load the classpath resources identifying Liquibase changelogs, and, if successful, creates a new Liquibase instance initialized to read from them, and returns it.

        This method may return null.

        Implementation Notes

        When a Liquibase instance is asked to perform an update operation, it operates on a single DatabaseChangeLog. But this class can specify several changelogs to read. Consequently, the Liquibase instance constructed by this method uses an internally built composite DatabaseChangeLog that logically aggregates all appropriate changelogs by virtue of its DatabaseChangeLog.include(String, boolean, ResourceAccessor) method. From the point of view of a Liquibase instance constructed by this method, therefore, there is only one DatabaseChangeLog in existence that has been formed by the inclusion of all relevant existing changelogs into one.

        Parameters:
        database - the Database to operate on; must not be null
        Returns:
        a new configured Liquibase instance, or null if there is no changelog to read and hence no reason to construct a Liquibase instance
        Throws:
        LiquibaseException - if a problem occurred while constructing the new Liquibase instance
        See Also:
        changeLogResourceExists(), getResourceAccessor(), Liquibase, Liquibase.Liquibase(DatabaseChangeLog, ResourceAccessor, Database), DatabaseChangeLog, DatabaseChangeLog.include(String, boolean, ResourceAccessor)

      • changeLogResourceExists

        protected boolean changeLogResourceExists()
        Returns true if at least one of the changelogs identified by the return value of the getChangeLogResourceNames() method actually exists.
        Returns:
        true if at least one of the changelogs identified by the return value of the getChangeLogResourceNames() method actually exists; false otherwise
        See Also:
        getChangeLogResourceNames()

      • changeLogResourceExists

        protected boolean changeLogResourceExists(String changeLogResourceName)

      • getResourceAccessor

        public ResourceAccessor getResourceAccessor()
        Returns the ResourceAccessor associated with this LiquiunitRule that will be used by the createLiquibase(Database) method while creating a Liquibase instance.

        This method may return null.

        A newly created LiquiunitRule will, by default, have a ResourceAccessor initialized with the following code:

        new CompositeResourceAccessor(new URLResourceAccessor(Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader()), 
                              new FileSystemResourceAccessor(System.getProperty("user.dir")))
        Returns:
        a ResourceAccessor, or null
        See Also:
        setResourceAccessor(ResourceAccessor)

      • setResourceAccessor

        public void setResourceAccessor(ResourceAccessor resourceAccessor)
        Sets the ResourceAccessor associated with this LiquiunitRule that will be used by the createLiquibase(Database) method while creating a Liquibase instance.
        Parameters:
        resourceAccessor - a ResourceAccessor; may be null
        See Also:
        getResourceAccessor()

      • shouldUpdate

        protected boolean shouldUpdate(Liquibase liquibase)
                        throws LiquibaseException,
                               SQLException
        Returns true if the supplied Liquibase instance should in fact have its Liquibase.update(String) method called.

        This implementation returns true if the liquibase.should.run system property is non-null and set to something other than false and if the supplied Liquibase instance is non-null and is connected to a database that does not yet have a DATABASECHANGELOG table in it.

        Parameters:
        liquibase - the Liquibase instance to check; may be null in which case false will be returned
        Returns:
        true if the supplied Liquibase instance should in fact have its Liquibase.update(String) method called
        Throws:
        LiquibaseException - if there was a Liquibase-related error
        SQLException - if there was a database-related error
        See Also:
        Liquibase.update(String)
